intro: Donax bifarius, commonly known as the coastal redwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in coastal areas of North and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with reddish-brown stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Donax bifarius is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in maritime environments.
